channel.title: Sher Valenzuela
channel.description: Sher Valenzuela Candidate for Lieutenant Governor of Delaware (Remarks as Prepared for Delivery)

item.title: Good evening. My name is Sher Valenzuela.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Two years ago, I never would have imagined that I would be here tonight, speaking at the Republican National Convention.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: I've seen these on TV ­ what an honor to be here with you.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: I'm a mother from Delaware, a co-owner with my husband of First State Manufacturing.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And after this November, I plan on taking on a new title: the next Lieutenant Governor of the Great State of Delaware.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Tonight, it is my honor to talk about the three themes that inspired me to run for office:
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: My family.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: The business we built.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And my belief in America's unlimited potential.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: But it starts with a wonderful story.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Shortly after our son was born, my husband and I received some news that would change our lives forever.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We learned that our son Simon was autistic. We loved him with every fiber in our being.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: But the "experts" told us not to expect much.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: "Your son will never learn to read, write, or communicate effectively," they said.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: "Accept these limits," they seemed to say.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: It was a tough time. We quickly realized that the jobs we had wouldn't pay for the professionals Simon needed to overcome the odds.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: So we followed a deep and long-standing American tradition.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We took a risk.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We bet on the future.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We started our own business.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: When he was serving in the Army, my husband had taken a mail order course on upholstery.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: One day I came home to find him pulling out the second hand sewing machine he'd learned his craft on.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: He called her "Old Betsy."
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: A second-generation Mexican-American, my husband will do whatever it takes to provide for his family.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Our friends thought we were crazy. Didn't we have enough challenges trying to raise Simon?
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Why not just accept our lot in life?
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: That's when I remembered something my dad used to say.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: My dad was an old school guy. A former drill sergeant. Blue collar union worker his whole life.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: He taught us to work hard and think big. I remember he once pulled off the road and pointed at a big factory.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: "That's more than a building," he told me.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: "It took a lot of work to get that big. It started out as just an idea at some guy's kitchen table."
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: I guess you could say our upholstery business was OUR kitchen table idea.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Fifteen years later we employ more than 70 people in our 70,000 square foot factory.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And we're so proud of what we do.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We make umpire vests for Little Leagues.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Products for the men and women serving our country.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Restaurant seats for pizza chains.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And protective gear for our allies in the Israeli military.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We're actually taking work away from Chinese and Mexican competitors ­ and bringing it back to Delaware!
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: How did it happen? We defied the odds.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: We rolled the dice on losing ­ or gaining ­ everything. We didn't listen to the experts. We grew our dream.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And with our son Simon, we didn't listen to the experts either.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Yes, he still struggles with autism. But this past June, he completed his first year at the University of Delaware.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: I can't tell you how much this means to him ­ and how much it means to me, the mom of a special needs child.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Raising our family and building our business have been the passions of our lives, and what struck me is how similar they are.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: If you've ever raised a child or started a business, you know what I'm talking about.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: You put your heart and soul into it.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: You work to find the 25th hour in the day
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: You struggle to overcome insurmountable odds.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And you do it all because you believe in an unlimited future.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: "An unlimited future." Isn't that what America is all about?
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: But today, when I talk to the young families and the struggling businesses I meet throughout Delaware, I have to ask: are we creating an unlimited future for them?
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: A Gallup report recently said nearly 50% of small businesses owners aren't hiring because of what they call "regulatory uncertainty."
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Can you blame them?
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: This Administration has imposed 106 new major regulations.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: They are on track to create 109 million new paperwork burden hours.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And by year's end, $110 billion dollars' worth of new regulatory costs will be laid on the backs of business owners and taxpayers.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: You might call that "regulatory uncertainty."
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: I call it an all-out assault on free enterprise.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: That's what worries me about this Administration. They seem so eager to "fix" society.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: But they don't have a clue about how to fix the economy. In the end, it all comes down to what you believe.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: And yes, they are believers!
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: The Obama Administration believes in "experts" and blue ribbon panels.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: They believe in creating new agencies and boards.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: They believe in all that ­ but they just don't trust the entrepreneur's ability to grow her own business and to create jobs.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Mitt Romney not only believes in the values of economic freedom. His entire life has been committed to advancing it.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Last April, I was privileged to be one of a dozen business leaders in Delaware to sit down and meet with Mitt Romney.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: This wasn't some scripted photo op; this wasn't a staged event; this was a real discussion with someone who understands where small business is coming from.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: You see, for Governor Romney, free enterprise isn't just a theory you study in graduate school. It's a creed. A commitment. A world view.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: It's what connects Americans, families, and communities, to an unlimited future.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: That's why this election is so important to our small businesses and to our country.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: I represent the small businesses, the women, and the families working so hard to rebuild our communities.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: In order to secure our unlimited future, we need a leader who understands the moral case for free enterprise.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Someone who believes in an unlimited future.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: These aren't just words to Mitt Romney. His track record proves it.
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Let's secure that future together by sending Mitt Romney and Paul Ryan to the White House in November!
item.author: Sher Valenzuela

item.title: Dios lo Bendiga! God Bless America!
item.author: Sher Valenzuela
